location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Primary audit on the return of coal recovered and expended on board the steam frigate Aucklandbetween 8 July 1850 and 21 May 1851, with the explanation of the Officer commanding the Aucklandannexed, with reference to his return of coal at Muscat from 1 September to 31 December 1851

mods.abstract: Audit of coal, drawn up in response to a discrepancy of 10 tonnes being noted, where 80 tonnes of coal were loaded from the depot at Muscat, but only 70 tonnes brought to account on the Auckland'sarrival in Bushire. The Commanding Officer of the Aucklandstates that the discrepancy can be accounted for by the dry state of the coal, and the considerable quantity of dust it contained.
